reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An amazingly well equipped studio suite. Can't think of anything it was missing that we may have needed. Beautiful outdoor hot tub and heated outdoor pool. Gorgeous location.
reviews.title: wonderful place to stay for a few days
Lovely location, but booking problems
reviews.text: Staff and management pleasant and helpful at all times.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at The Pemberton Valley Lodge as part of our honeymoon in BC - it's a lovely place to stay, modern and well equipped, especially the 1 bed suites. However, we had a few problems with our room booking.
reviews.title: Snow Falling in Hot Tub

likes.liked: — The room and views, the outdoor pool and hot tub.
likes.disliked: — It was hard to find someone to deliver a pizza.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked through hotels.com, and chose a 1 bed suite over a studio, as we wanted in suite washing facilities, full kitchen and a seperate bedroom and sitting area. When we arrived we went to our room to find it was a studio. So we asked about it at reception, to be told in not very courteous terms that a studio was what we had booked... even though I could see on our booking piece of paper they were holding that it said "1 bedroom suite". We eventually convinced them that we had paid for a 1 bed, only to be told "well, we don't have any for the first 3 nights of your stay... but you can use the communal clothes washing facilities!"
reviews.title: Great Value!
Great location, nice decor, very comfortable
reviews.text: We eventually got a 1 bed suite (which was lovely) for the final 2 nights of our 5 night stay, but were offered no compensation and very little apology, which has made us feel slightly negative towards the experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent four days skiing in Whistler over the Presidents day Holiday weekend. Since Whistler accomodation was quite expensive, we decided to stay in Pemberton, which only 30 min away from Whistler. The drive between Whistler and Pemberton wasn't bad at all. We got a small studio room with a kitchen. The room was large enough for two of us to have dinner and relax. There was a washer/dyer you could use for free on the same floor. Wireless internet access is available in the lobby area. We went shopping at a local grocery store and cooked dinner most of the nights. If you want to do an economical ski trip to Whistler, and don't care about Apres Ski activities that much, this is the place to stay.
reviews.title: Quiet Stay in Pemberton

likes.disliked: — No internet connection from the room

reviews.title: Sunny weekend in Pembie
reviews.text: We along with another couple stayed two nights at the Pemberton Valley Lodge and paid $128 (AAA rate) for a Queen bed with a sofa bed during the BC Day long weekend. The room also had a balcony and a kitchenette.

We had arrived early and were told that our room was not yet ready. Upon our return, we were given a room facing the highway. As we went up to our room we opened the door to find that the room was not yet made up. We ended up speaking with housekeeping who arranged for us to check into a room that they had just finished cleaning. It was facing away from the highway.
reviews.title: Just a stones throw from Whistler and great!

reviews.text: I surveyed the room quickly and was pleased to find it tastefully furnished. It did however have a sticky balcony door and was missing one set of bath towels.
reviews.title: I liked this hotel, but...

likes.disliked: — Getting overcharged for little things-and having to ask for coat hangers !(they aren't included in the room unless you do)

reviews.title: 3rd time is a charm
reviews.text: Pros of the Lodge were the full sized barbecue with tables at poolside (ask for bbq utensils at front desk), kitchenette with fridge, modern decor, in suite washer and dryer, two tvs (one in the bedroom and one in the living room), and free underground parking.

Stayed 2 nights in a 1 bedroom suite. Room was pleasant, even with the tacky fake fireplace. But avoid rooms around #103. You'll be kept awake by the electric garage door just below opening and closing.
reviews.title: Nice room...but

reviews.text: Also the advertised wireless Internet access doesn't work in the room. It costs $10/day extra and you have to go to the lobby to have a hope of using it.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: We had a family wedding near Pemberton, and had rooms reserved at the Pemberton Valley Lodge. New building was a pleasure. We booked a 1 bedroom suite so that we didn't have to share a room with the kids. They slept in the hideabed. Kitchen had all the amenities, and was well equipped with cutlery, plates, etc.
reviews.title: Loved It!
Pleasant Surprise
reviews.text: There were 2 large TVs, the one in the living room came with a DVD player. Satelite TV was available.

reviews.title: management
reviews.text: The swimming pool was heated, and the hot tub was at 40C. The exercise room seemed small (I didn't use it).

reviews.title: Fine place to stay.
reviews.text: We stayed in a studio room, above the dreaded garage door. The room itself was fine, though the kitchen equipment left a little to be desired. We needed to ask for an ironing board - ours was missing!

We thoroughly enjoyed our four days at the lodge but I do agree with the earlier comment about avoiding rooms over the garage door. The noise was not enough to disrupt our sleeping but was irritating at times.
reviews.title: Great Getaway - 20 mins from Whistler

reviews.text: The pool is relatively small but catches the afternoon sun. The fitness room is tiny, but works. There were not many people around while we were there, so the lack of space was not an issue.
reviews.title: Awesome place!
great place for families
reviews.text: Staff were efficient, helpful and friendly. Views from the room were delightful though I was little disappointed to note that property at the back is quite close, but shielded with trees.

reviews.title: Remote, but lovely
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a weekend and we really enjoyed our stay. We loved the fact that the room had a fully equipped kitchen and that it was newly renovated (even had DVD players). Great value for the money and it was close enough to Whistler that we were able to spend most of our time in Whistler and go back to the lodge for a dip in their nice pool and hot tub.We highly recommend this hotel.
